basics.name: Pässi Villanen
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Pässi hails from [Tampere](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tampere). Holds a bachelor's degree from the *Tampere University* and a master's degree from *Aalto University*. Before starting **Pässisoft**, he worked for **Finnair** as a part time software developer. While his work focuses on *applied information theory*, mostly *optimizing lossless compression* schema of both the length-limited and adaptive variants, his non-work interests range widely, everything from *quantum computing* to *chaos theory*. He could tell you about it, but THAT would NOT be a *length-limited* conversation!

work.name: CyberSec Finland
work.summary: CyberSec Finland is a Finnish cyber security company that provides innovative solutions to protect businesses and individuals from cyber attacks. As a Software Developer at the company, I was responsible for developing and maintaining the company's flagship product, which provides advanced threat detection and response capabilities.
highlights: Developed and maintained the company's flagship product for advanced threat detection and response
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to ensure product functionality and customer satisfaction
Designed and implemented custom software solutions for client needs
Researched and evaluated new technologies and tools to improve product capabilities
Provided technical support and troubleshooting assistance to clients

work.name: FinTech Innovations
work.summary: FinTech Innovations is a Finnish financial technology company that provides cutting-edge solutions for the banking and finance industry. As a Senior Software Engineer at the company, I was responsible for leading the development of a new mobile banking app that resulted in a 50% increase in user engagement.
highlights: Led the development of a new mobile banking app resulting in a 50% increase in user engagement
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to ensure app functionality and customer satisfaction
Designed and implemented scalable software solutions for the finance industry
Managed and mentored a team of junior developers
Conducted code reviews and implemented best practices for software development

work.name: Grand Helsinki Hotel
work.summary: Grand Helsinki Hotel is a 5-star hotel located in the heart of Helsinki. As a Junior Software Developer at the hotel, I was responsible for maintaining and developing the hotel's website and reservation system. During my time there, I implemented a new online booking system that resulted in a 25% increase in online bookings.
highlights: Developed and maintained the hotel's website and reservation system
Implemented a new online booking system resulting in a 25% increase in online bookings
Worked closely with the hotel's marketing team to improve the hotel's online presence
Developed custom tools and applications to improve hotel operations
Provided technical support to hotel staff and guests

volunteer.summary: As a shepherd, I took care of sheep and lambs on a farm in Finland. I learned how to raise and feed them, how to manage their health, and how to shear their wool. I enjoyed spending time outdoors and working with animals.
highlights: Raised and cared for sheep and lambs
Managed their health and nutrition
Learned how to shear wool
Worked on a farm in Finland

volunteer.summary: As a volunteer tutor for the Finnish Red Cross, I taught math to young students in need. It was a fulfilling experience, and I enjoyed helping others learn. I also appreciated the opportunity to give back to my community.
highlights: Taught math to students in need
Volunteered for the Finnish Red Cross
Helped others learn
Gave back to my community

awards.title: Best Sheep Farmer of the Year
awards.summary: Received the award for my outstanding contributions to the sheep farming industry.

awards.title: Best Knitted Sweater
awards.summary: Received the award for my hand-knitted sweater, which was made from wool produced on my farm.

publications.name: The Sheep Farm
publications.summary: A book about sheep farming in Finland.

references.name: Pekka Perä
references.reference: Pekka is known for his love of nature and often spends time with his sheep, taking care of the lambs during the spring season.

references.name: Maija Mäki
references.reference: Maija is a farmer who raises sheep and has won several awards for the quality of her wool.

references.name: Antti Ahonen
references.reference: Antti has been a shepherd for over 20 years and has a vast knowledge of sheep and their behavior. He often shares his insights on his blog, which has a dedicated following among sheep enthusiasts.

projects.name: Lamb.js
projects.description: *Lamb.js* is a runtime for JavaScript and TypeScript that is based on the V8 JavaScript engine and the Rust programming language. It was created by a Finnish developer who is passionate about sheep farming and wanted to create a runtime that is focused on productivity while paying homage to their roots. It was announced in 2018 during a talk about the intersection of technology and agriculture.
highlights: Designed for productivity and efficiency
Built with Rust and V8 JavaScript engine
Incorporates principles of sheep farming
Reflects the values of the Finnish developer

projects.name: Finnish Node
projects.description: *Finnish Node* is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside a web browser. It was developed and maintained by a Finnish developer who is passionate about technology and its impact on agriculture. They wanted to create a platform that is efficient and sustainable, just like their approach to sheep farming.
highlights: Efficient and sustainable platform
Developed and maintained by a Finnish developer
Designed for the intersection of technology and agriculture
